title: School districts prepare for boycotts of Common Core tests
text:
School districts prepare for boycotts of Common Core tests March 25, 2017 7:25 PM By John Hildebrand 
advertisement | advertise on newsday Longwood Middle School is currently preparing to take the English Language Arts exam next week, which will be a computerized test. Beginning last year, the school experimented with a field test that Lisa Mato, director of special programs and data reporting for the Longwood School District, said "went extremely well." (Credit: Ed Betz) 
Public school districts across Long Island and the state are bracing for what many educators and parents expect to be a fifth consecutive year of Common Core test boycotts in grades three through eight, even as eight districts in Nassau and Suffolk counties and dozens elsewhere introduce computerized versions of the exams.
